results.title: Girl's sports: on the right track
results.brief_description: Considers the limited opportunities available to women who want to compete in sporting events. Shows how these limitations are being replaced by new opportunities for women in a variety of competitive sports including track and field. Through a short history of track and field, with original archive footage of Babe Didrikson and Wilma Rudolf, the limitations that were available for women to compete in sporting events are shown. The experiences of three high-school girls - a cross-country runner, a shot putter and a broad jumper - shows the new opportunities available for girls today.

results.title: Giotto
results.brief_description: Shows the skill and beauty of Giotto’s work in Assisi as well as placing it in its political, religious and artistic context.

results.title: Gibraltar: Gateway to the Mediterranean
results.brief_description: The present political and economic situation in Gibraltar. Highlights historic events; emphasises the strategic importance ; its development as a naval base and the value of tis airstrip. Discusses the controversy with Spain. Shows familiar tourist attractions.

results.title: Ghost town
results.brief_description: Uses ultra high contrast photography to convey the derelict nature of buildings and surroundings of the abandoned Overland Telegraph Station at Peake Creek, South Australia. No narration.

results.title: Ghana today
results.brief_description: The epic story of the emergence of independence of the Gold Coast of Africa. Established by the Portuguese in the 15th century, Ghana became a British colony in 1874. The accent in this programme is on Prime Minister Nkrumah, political hero, and magnetic leader. Shows the industrial and social development since independence, proving that Ghana has won the right to freedom under Nkrumah.

results.title: Ghana greets the Queen
results.brief_description: The vision and vigour of the Republic of Ghana provide backcloth to this account of the Royal tour in November 1961. Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and HRH Prince Philip were welcomed in Accra, where an exciting regatta and an inspection of Ghana’s armed forces and police were among engagements.

results.title: Geyser melodies
results.creator_credit: Guy Haselton and Guy O Hasleton Productions
results.brief_description: The world’s greatest display of geysers and hot springs in Yellowstone National Park in North America. Shown as being closely akin to nature’s most awesome spectacle - volcanoes. Designed to promote a better understanding of the earth’s beginnings and to show the artistry of nature in one of its most spectacular forms.
